Sports and Clubs: Member: (i) Indian Polo Association, (ii) Equestrian Federation of India,(iii) Defence Services Officers` Institue, (iv) Delhi golf Club (v) United Services Institute, (vi) India International Centre, (vii) International Institute of Strategic Studies, London; antiquarian, bibliophile, music, horses, equestrian sports, gold and chess
Social And Cultural Activities: Through his foundation, he provides ambulance service in the desert districts of Barmer and Jaislmer, his home districts. To promote and disseminate the literature of `Dingal`(an ancient local language) he has established another foundation. He is also a trustee on various charities engaged in running hospitals, museums and water conservation projects.
Favourite Pastime and Recreation: Works with music,playing chess preferably against a computer and golf
Special Interests: A lover of horses, and himself a skilled horseman;the patron-in-chief of the Indian Polo Association, having himself been a player.
Educational Qualifications: B.A., B.Sc. Educated at Mayo College, Ajmer, Joint Services Wing, Clement Town, Dehradun. N.D.A. Khadakvasla and Indian Military Academy, Dehradun, Uttarakhand
Other Information: Commissioned to the Central India Horse in 1957; resigned Commission to join politics; Chaired several Task Forces to recommend policy to the Government amongst others on (i) Telecommunications, (ii) Information Technology, and (iii) Energy; was member of Group of Ministries on (a) Reforming the National Security System (b) Hydrocarbon Vision 2025
